rules.surveyText:
ASK IF S6=1

Family Origin

S6a. Which of the following best describes your family’s country or region of origin? _Select all that apply._
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask S6a (Family Origin) to respondents who answered Yes to Hispanic/Latino origin (S6 = 1).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have indicated they are of Hispanic or Latino origin (S6 = 1).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF A4=7,8,9,10, 11, 12, OR 13

Form of drink 1 and 2

A5. When you had the \[INSERT A4\], which of the following reflects the form of the drink?
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A5 (Form of drink) to respondents who selected A4 = any of the spirit categories listed (options 7–13).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent's alcoholic beverage type (A4) must be one of the specified spirit options (A4 in {7,8,9,10,11,12,13}).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 IS ON-PREMISE

When decided on drink 1 and 2

A6. Which of the following reflect why you drank \[INSERT A4\]?
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A6 (reasons for choosing the drink) when the drink occurred at an on-premise location (i.e., the location for this loop iteration is classified as on-premise).
rules.conditionDescription: The looped location (from S9 assignment for this occasion) must be an on-premise location.

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF A9 DOES NOT EQUAL 1

Number of people 1 and 2

A10. Including yourself, how many people were with you when you had this drink? _Enter a whole number_.
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A10 (number of people) to respondents who did not select 'I was alone' in A9.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have indicated in A9 that they were not alone (A9 ≠ 1).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF A4=4,5,7,8,9,10, 11, 12, OR 13

Brand Occasion 1 and 2

A13. What brand of \[INSERT A4\] did you have? _Select one_.
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A13 (brand) for respondents whose A4 beverage type is one of the listed categories (4,5,7–13).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent's alcoholic beverage type (A4) must be in the specified set (A4 in {4,5,7,8,9,10,11,12,13}).

rules.surveyText:
ASK A13b IF A13a=1

A13b. What other drinks did you have in addition to \[INSERT A4\]? Select all that apply.
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A13b (other drinks consumed) to respondents who indicated in A13a that they had one or more additional drinks (A13a = 1).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have answered Yes to having other drinks in addition to the target drink (A13a = 1).

rules.surveyText:
ASK A14a-A19 IF LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 IS OFF-PREMISE

Purchaser of Alcohol

A14a. When you recently had a drink \[LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2\], which of the following best describes your role in the original purchase of \[INSERT A4\] for it? _Select one._
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A14a and the block A14b–A19 only when the occasion's location is off-premise. Several follow-ups (A14b–A19) are further gated by answers within that block (see dependent rules).
rules.conditionDescription: The looped location (from S9 assignment for this occasion) must be an off-premise location.

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF A14a=1

Location of Purchase 1 and 2

A14b. Given you purchased the \[INSERT A4\] for the drink you recently had \[LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2\], where did you originally make the purchase?
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A14b (where they purchased the drink) to respondents who indicated they themselves went to the store/made the purchase (A14a = 1).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have said they purchased the drink themselves (A14a = 1).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF A4=7 WAS CHOSEN FOR LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 AND A14a=1

Vodka Size 1 and 2

A15. What size was the bottle of vodka you purchased at \[INSERT A14b ANSWER WITHOUT PARENTHESES\]? _Select one_
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A15 (vodka bottle size) when the beverage type is Vodka (A4 = 7) and the respondent indicated they purchased it themselves (A14a = 1).
rules.conditionDescription: Both conditions must hold: A4 = 7 (Vodka) AND A14a = 1 (respondent purchased it).

rules.surveyText:
A14a=1

Purchase Intent 1 and 2

A16. Which of the following best describes describe why you decided to purchase \[INSERT A4\]? ...

Intent for Location of Purchase 1 and 2

A17. Earlier you said you purchased \[INSERT A4\] from \[INSERT A14b WITHOUT PARENTHESIS\]. Which of the following best describes why you purchased from \[INSERT A14\] instead of another location?

Purchase Reason 1 and 2

A18. Which of the following best describes why you chose to buy \[INSERT A4\] instead of another type of alcohol?

A19. When you purchased the \[INSERT A4\], which of the following best describes why you chose \[INSERT BRAND FROM A13; IF A13=99: that brand\]?
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A16–A19 (purchase-related follow-ups) to respondents who indicated they purchased the drink themselves (A14a = 1).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have indicated they purchased the drink (A14a = 1).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF ANY BRAND SELECTED IN A21

A22. Which of the following brands do you associate with the following attribute: \[INSERT ATTRIBUTE FROM ATTRIBUTE BRAND LIST IN APPENDIX IN BOLD/BLUE\]? _Select all that apply._

PN: ASK A22 ONCE FOR EACH ATTRIBUTE—RANDOMIZE ATTRIBUTE ORDER; SHOW BRANDS SELECTED IN A21
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask A22 (brand-attribute association) to respondents who selected at least one brand in A21. The question is repeated once per attribute and shows only the brands the respondent selected in A21.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have selected one or more brands in A21 (i.e., A21 not empty / at least one brand chosen).

rules.surveyText:
A23. How likely are you to consider the following brands the next time you have a drink? _Select one._

PN: SHOW BRANDS SELECTED IN A21—RANDOMIZE BRAND LIST
rules.plainTextRule: For A23, show/respond about brands only for the specific brand items the respondent selected in A21 (row-level): each brand row should be shown only if that brand was selected in A21.
rules.conditionDescription: Each brand row in A23 is shown only when the respondent selected that brand previously in A21.
